Package com.datastrcrew.libraryapi.classes

Class BinaryTree<E>

java.lang.Object
com.datastrcrew.libraryapi.classes.BinaryTree<E>
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BinarySearchTree
public class BinaryTree<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
Class for a binary tree that stores generic objects.
Author:
Koffman and Wolfgang
See Also:
Serialized Form

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    BinaryTree()
    Construct an empty BinaryTree
    BinaryTree​(E data, BinaryTree<E> leftTree, BinaryTree<E> rightTree)
    Constructs a new binary tree with data in its root,leftTree as its left subtree and rightTree as its right subtree.

    • BinaryTree

      public BinaryTree​(E data, BinaryTree<E> leftTree, BinaryTree<E> rightTree)
      Constructs a new binary tree with data in its root,leftTree as its left subtree and rightTree as its right subtree.
      Parameters:
      data - data object.
      leftTree - left tree.
      rightTree - right tree.

  • Method Details

    • getLeftSubtree

      public BinaryTree<E> getLeftSubtree()
      Return the left subtree.
      Returns:
      The left subtree or null if either the root or the left subtree is null

    • getRightSubtree

      public BinaryTree<E> getRightSubtree()
      Return the right sub-tree
      Returns:
      the right sub-tree or null if either the root or the right subtree is null.

    • getRoot

      public E getRoot()
      Return the data field of the root
      Returns:
      the data field of the root or null if the root is null

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Returns:
      true if empty, false if not

    • size

      public int size()

    • isLeaf

      public boolean isLeaf()
      Determine whether this tree is a leaf.
      Returns:
      true if the root has no children

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      The binary tree
      Throws:
